member.name: T:AMS.TextBox.TextBox
member.summary: Base class for all TextBox classes in this namespace. It holds a Behavior object that may be associated to it by a derived class.

member.name: F:AMS.TextBox.TextBox.m_behavior
member.summary: The Behavior object associated with this TextBox.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.TextBox.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TextBox class.
member.remarks: This constructor is just for convenience for derived classes. It does nothing.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.TextBox.#ctor(AMS.TextBox.Behavior)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TextBox class by explicitly assigning its Behavior field.
member.param: The object to associate the textbox with.
member.remarks: This constructor provides a way for derived classes to set the internal Behavior object to something other than the default value (such as null).

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.TextBox.UpdateText
member.summary: Checks if the textbox's text is valid and if not updates it with a valid value.
member.returns: If the textbox's text is updated (because it wasn't valid), the return value is true; otherwise it is false.
member.remarks: This method delegates to Behavior.UpdateText.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.TextBox.ModifyFlags(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds or removes flags from self's Behavior.
member.param: The bits to be turned on (ORed) or turned off in the internal flags member.
If true the flags are added, otherwise they're removed.
member.remarks: This method delegates to Behavior.ModifyFlags.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.TextBox.Validate
member.summary: Checks if the textbox's value is valid and if not proceeds according to the behavior's .
member.returns: If the validation succeeds, the return value is true; otherwise it is false.
member.remarks: This method delegates to Behavior.Validate.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.TextBox.IsValid
member.summary: Checks if the textbox contains a valid value.
member.returns: If the value is valid, the return value is true; otherwise it is false.
member.remarks: This method delegates to Behavior.IsValid.

member.summary: Show an error message box.

member.remarks: This property delegates to Behavior.ShowErrorMessageBox.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.TextBox.ShowErrorIcon(System.String)
member.summary: Show a blinking icon next to the textbox with an error message.

member.remarks: This property delegates to Behavior.ShowErrorIcon.

member.name: T:AMS.TextBox.MultiMaskedTextBox
member.summary: TextBox class which supports multiple behaviors, based on a mask string.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.MultiMaskedTextBox.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the MultiMaskedTextBox class by setting its mask to an empty string and setting its Behavior field to Alphanumeric.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.MultiMaskedTextBox.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the MultiMaskedTextBox class by setting its mask field and corresponding Behavior.
member.param: The mask string to use for determining what behavior to associate with this textbox.

member.name: P:AMS.TextBox.MultiMaskedTextBox.Behavior
member.summary: Gets the Behavior object currently associated with this class.
member.remarks: The actual Behavior class is dependent on the assigned to this class.

member.name: P:AMS.TextBox.MultiMaskedTextBox.Mask
member.summary: Gets or sets the mask string used to determine which Behavior object to associate with this class.
member.remarks:
The mask string is interpreted as follows:
##/##/#### ##:##:## = Date and time (with seconds). The location of the month and the hour format are retrieved from the user's system.
##/##/#### ##:## = Date and time (without seconds). The location of the month and the hour format are retrieved from the user's system.
##/##/#### = Date. The location of the month is retrieved from the user's system.
##:##:## = Time (with seconds). The location of hour format is retrieved from the user's system.
##:## = Time (without seconds). The location of hour format is retrieved from the user's system.
If it looks like a numeric value, such as ### or #,###.### (without foreign characters after the first #) then it's treated as a number; otherwise it's treated as a masked value (e.g., ###-####).

member.remarks: The end must be greater than or equal to the start position. If nothing gets selected, the text is inserted at the caret's position.

member.summary: If TRACE_AMS (and TRACE) are defined for the compiler, a message line is sent to the tracer.
member.param: The message line to trace.
member.remarks: This method is used to help diagnose problems. It's called at the beginning of all event handlers (the ones that begin with Handle) to trace the program's execution.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.Behavior.Validate
member.summary: Checks if the textbox's value is valid and if not proceeds according to the behavior's .
member.returns: If the validation succeeds, the return value is true; otherwise it is false.
member.remarks: This method is automatically called by the textbox's event if its property is set to true. It delegates to the overridable version of Validate.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.Behavior.Validate(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if the textbox's value is valid and if not proceeds according to the given set of flags.
member.param: The combination of zero or more values added (ORed) together. This determines if the value should be checked for being empty, invalid, or neither, and then what action to take.
If true and the validation fails (based on the flags parameter), the focus is placed on the textbox.
member.returns: If the validation succeeds, the return value is true; otherwise it is false.
member.remarks: This method is indirectly called by the textbox's event if its property is set to true. Although doing so is not expected, this method may be overriden to provide extra validation in derived classes.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.Behavior.IsValid
member.summary: Checks if the textbox contains a valid value.
member.returns: If the value is valid, the return value is true; otherwise it is false.
member.remarks: This method is called by the to check validity. Here it just returns true, but it is meant to be overriden by Behavior classes where either the allowed range of values is not controlled as the user types (e.g. NumericBehavior, TimeBehavior), or the value is not considered valid until the user has entered all the required characters (e.g. DateBehavior, TimeBehavior).

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.Behavior.AddEventHandlers
member.summary: Attaches several textBox event handlers to their corresponding virtual methods of the Behavior class.
member.remarks: To alter a textBox's behavior, these events may be needed: KeyDown, KeyPress, TextChanged, Validating, and LostFocus. This method binds those events to these virtual methods: HandleKeyDown, HandleKeyPress, HandleTextChanged, HandleValidating, and HandleLostFocus. Derived behavior classes may override any of these methods to accomodate their own requirements.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.Behavior.RemoveEventHandlers
member.summary: Dettaches several textBox event handlers from their corresponding virtual methods of the Behavior class.
member.remarks: This method does the opposite of and it allows a Behavior object to be associated with a textBox and later replaced by a different Behavior object.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.Behavior.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the object by dettaching the textBox event handlers from their corresponding virtual methods of the Behavior class and setting the Textbox to null.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.Behavior.HandleKeyDown(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles keyboard presses inside the textbox.
member.param: The object who sent the event.
The event data.
member.remarks: This method is virtual so that it can be overriden by derived classes to accomodate their own behavior. Here it just sets e.Handled to false so that the keydown can happen.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.Behavior.HandleKeyPress(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.KeyPressEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles keyboard presses inside the textbox.
member.param: The object who sent the event.
The event data.
member.remarks: This method is virtual so that it can be overriden by derived classes to accomodate their own behavior. Here it just sets e.Handled to false so that the keypress can happen.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.Behavior.HandleTextChanged(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Handles changes in the textbox text.
member.param: The object who sent the event.
The event data.
member.remarks: This method is virtual so that it can be overriden by derived classes to accomodate their own behavior. Here it calls (unless the internal flag is true) to ensure the text is kept valid.

The event data.

The event data.

The event data.

member.name: P:AMS.TextBox.MaskedBehavior.Mask
member.summary: Gets or sets the mask.
member.remarks:
This string is used for validating and/or formatting the characters entered by the user. By default, the # symbol is configured to represent a digit placeholder on the mask. Thus, each '#' symbol in the mask represents a digit, and any other characters between the # symbols are automatically filled-in as the user types digits.
If this property is changed, is automatically called.

member.name: P:AMS.TextBox.MaskedBehavior.Symbols
member.summary: Gets the ArrayList of Symbol objects.
member.remarks: This array will initially contain one record: the one for the # symbol, which represents a digit placeholder on the mask. However, more Symbol objects can be easily added to the array to make the mask more powerful.

member.name: T:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior
member.summary: Behavior class which handles numeric input.
member.remarks: This is the base class for the other numeric behavior classes. It ensures that the user enters a valid number and provides features such as automatic formatting. It also allows precise control over what the number can look like, such as how many digits to the left and right of the decimal point, and whether it can be negative or not.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.TextBoxBase)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NumericBehavior class by associating it with a TextBoxBase derived object.
member.param: The TextBoxBase object to associate with this behavior. It must not be null.
member.remarks: This constructor sets = 9, = 4, = 0, = "", = true, and the rest of the properties according to user's system.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.TextBoxBase,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NumericBehavior class by associating it with a TextBoxBase derived object and setting the maximum number of digits allowed left and right of the decimal point.
member.param: The TextBoxBase object to associate with this behavior. It must not be null.

member.name: P:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.MaxWholeDigits
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of digits allowed left of the decimal point.

member.name: P:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.MaxDecimalPlaces
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of digits allowed right of the decimal point.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the value is allowed to be negative or not.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to true, meaning that negative values are allowed. If this property is changed, is automatically called.

member.name: P:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.AddDecimalAfterMaxWholeDigits
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a is automatically inserted if the user enters a digit after the have been entered
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to false, meaning that when the have been entered, a is not automaticall inserted -- the user has to do it manually. If this property is changed, is automatically called.

member.name: P:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.DigitsInGroup
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of digits to place in each group to the left of the decimal point.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to 0. It may be set to 3 to group thousands using the group separator. If this property is changed, is automatically called.

member.name: P:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.DecimalPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the character to use for the decimal point.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set based on the user's system settings. If this property is changed, is automatically called.

member.name: P:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.GroupSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets the character to use for the group separator.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set based on the user's system settings. In the US, this is typically a comma and it is used to separate the thousands. If this property is changed, is automatically called.

member.name: P:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.NegativeSign
member.summary: Gets or sets the character to use for the negative sign.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set based on the user's system settings, but it will likely be a minus sign. If this property is changed, is automatically called.

member.name: P:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.Prefix
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to automatically insert in front of the number, such as a currency symbol.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to an empty string. If this property is changed, is automatically called.

member.name: P:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.RangeMin
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value allowed.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to , however the range is only checked when the control loses focus if one of the flags is set.

member.name: P:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.RangeMax
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value allowed.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to , however the range is only checked when the control loses focus if one of the flags is set.

member.name: P:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.Mask
member.summary: Gets or sets a mask value representative of this object's properties.
member.remarks:
This property can be set to configure these other properties: , , , , , and .
For example, "$ #,###.##" means MaxWholeDigits = 4, MaxDecimalPlaces = 2, DigitsInGroup = 3, Prefix = "$ ", DecimalPoint = '.', and GroupSeparator = ','.
The # character is used to denote a digit placeholder.

member.name: P:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.ErrorMessage

member.name: P:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.NumericText

member.name: P:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.RealNumericText
member.summary: Retrieves the textbox's value without any non-numeric characters, and with a period for the decimal point and a minus for the negative sign.

member.name: F:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.Flag.AddDecimalAfterMaxWholeDigits

member.name: F:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.LostFocusFlag.PadWithZerosAfterDecimal

member.name: F:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.LostFocusFlag.DontPadWithZerosIfEmpty

member.name: F:AMS.TextBox.NumericBehavior.LostFocusFlag.RemoveExtraLeadingZeros
member.summary: Insignificant zeros are removed from the numeric value left of the decimal point, unless the number itself is 0.

member.name: T:AMS.TextBox.CurrencyBehavior
member.summary: Behavior class useful for entering monetary values.
member.remarks: This is just a class customized to make the value look monetary. It sets the to the currency sign specified in the user's system (such as a '$'). It also separates thousands using the character specified in the system (such as a comma). It sets to whatever is specified in the system -- usually two.

If the system has the currency symbol configured to be placed in front of the value, then it is assigned to the . Also, the number is automatically padded with zeros after the when the textbox loses focus.

member.name: T:AMS.TextBox.DateBehavior
member.summary: Behavior class which handles input of date values in mm/dd/yyyy or dd/mm/yyyy format.
member.remarks: This behavior is designed to let the user enter a date value quickly and accurately. As the user enters the digits, the slashes are automatically filled in. The user may only remove characters from the right side of the value entered. This helps to keep the value properly formatted. The user may also use the up/down arrow keys to increment/decrement the month, day, or year, depending on the location of the caret.

member.name: T:AMS.TextBox.TimeBehavior
member.summary: Behavior class which handles input of time values.
member.remarks: This behavior supports time values in 12 or 24 hour format, with or without seconds. It is designed to let the user enter a time value quickly and accurately. As the user enters the digits, the colons are automatically filled in. The user may only remove characters from the right side of the value entered. This helps to keep the value properly formatted. The user may also use the up/down arrow keys to increment/decrement the hour, minute, second, or AM/PM, depending on the location of the caret.

member.remarks: This is 0 by default, however it may be changed to allow another value to be placed in front of the time, such as a date.

member.name: M:AMS.TextBox.TimeBehavior.GetValidHour(System.Boolean)

member.returns: The return value is the valid value for the hour.
member.remarks: The method checks the value of the hour on the textbox. If it is a valid hour, it returns it. If it is less than it should be, the minimum is returned. If it is more than it should be, the maximum is returned.

member.returns: The return value is the valid value for the second.
